meanings.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a particular disease
meanings.sent1: The fever and rash were pathognomonic of measles.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recognized the pathognomonic symptoms of the flu.
meanings.sent3: It was pathognomonic how quickly the cake disappeared at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her red nose was pathognomonic of her embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The loud sneeze was pathognomonic of his presence in the quiet library.

meanings.definition: Serving as a distinct indication or sign of a specific condition
meanings.sent1: The sudden drop in temperature was pathognomonic of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The unique smell was pathognomonic of the bakery around the corner.
meanings.sent3: His bright tie was pathognomonic of his quirky personality.
meanings.sent4: The old clock was pathognomonic of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds were pathognomonic of the arrival of spring.
